@qiluo-msft due to limited permission please add a label of bug as well as requested for 202111

> def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db):

you can add a new parameter `blocking` with default value `True`.

Change the internal blocking accordingly. No need to check `exists`.

The benefit is to keep old behavior, and allow client code to change behavior case by case.

---
In reply to: [1067627217](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/pull/117#issuecomment-1067627217) [](http://example.com/codeflow?ancestors=1067627217)

---
Refers to: src/swsssdk/port_util.py:162 in 9beb381. [](commit_id = 9beb381db7c2910b407252287bd2820f4f4b5e47, deletion_comment = False)

> > def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db):
> 
> you can add a new parameter `blocking` with default value `True`.
> 
> Change the internal blocking accordingly. No need to check `exists`.
> 
> The benefit is to keep old behavior, and allow client code to change behavior case by case.
> 
> Refers to: src/swsssdk/port_util.py:162 in [9beb381](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/commit/9beb381db7c2910b407252287bd2820f4f4b5e47). [](commit_id = [9beb381](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/commit/9beb381db7c2910b407252287bd2820f4f4b5e47), deletion_comment = False)

Hi @qiluo-msft , I would like to confirm your comment here:

1. add a parameter to get_vlan_interface_oid_map
```python
def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db, blocking=True):
    ...
```
2. and change snmpagent code to call it like:
```
get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db, blocking=False)
```

Correct?

> > > def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db):
> > 
> > 
> > you can add a new parameter `blocking` with default value `True`.
> > Change the internal blocking accordingly. No need to check `exists`.
> > The benefit is to keep old behavior, and allow client code to change behavior case by case.
> > Refers to: src/swsssdk/port_util.py:162 in [9beb381](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/commit/9beb381db7c2910b407252287bd2820f4f4b5e47). [](commit_id = [9beb381](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/commit/9beb381db7c2910b407252287bd2820f4f4b5e47), deletion_comment = False)
> 
> Hi @qiluo-msft , I would like to confirm your comment here:
> 
> 1. add a parameter to get_vlan_interface_oid_map
> 
> ```python
> def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db, blocking=True):
>     ...
> ```
> 
> 2. and change snmpagent code to call it like:
> 
> ```
> get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db, blocking=False)
> ```
> 
> Correct?

```
--- a/src/swsssdk/port_util.py
+++ b/src/swsssdk/port_util.py
@@ -164,13 +164,13 @@ def get_rif_port_map(db):
 
     return rif_port_oid_map
 
-def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db):
+def get_vlan_interface_oid_map(db, blocking=True):
     """
         Get Vlan Interface names and sai oids
     """
     db.connect('COUNTERS_DB')
-    rif_name_map = db.get_all('COUNTERS_DB', 'COUNTERS_RIF_NAME_MAP', blocking=True)
-    rif_type_name_map = db.get_all('COUNTERS_DB', 'COUNTERS_RIF_TYPE_MAP', blocking=True)
+    rif_name_map = db.get_all('COUNTERS_DB', 'COUNTERS_RIF_NAME_MAP', blocking=blocking)
+    rif_type_name_map = db.get_all('COUNTERS_DB', 'COUNTERS_RIF_TYPE_MAP', blocking=blocking)
```

@vperumal @anamehra @VenkatCisco fyi

@qiluo-msft could you take a look at this PR please (looks like you've been the most recent approver in this PR)?

This is a very minor utility change that will be useful in preventing unnecessary warning logs in certain scenarios - e.g. when show commands query Redis for many fields without checking if they're present, and are able to handle the case where they're not present.

>                 if blocking:

I have second thought about the solution. Since the functions are throwing exceptions with the message, it is the caller's responsibility to handle and log

0. We should remove the logging statements from the basic functions `keys`/`get`/`get_all`/etc, if it is followed by a throw.
1. We may add the logging statements into the `blocking` branch in the function `wrapped`. Then no behavior change in this condition.
2. For non blocking branch, we swallow the `UnavailableDataError` and `return None`. The caller should get well understanding what happening, and even the caller does not handle well, the further exception on None object should be clear. So I think we are okay with the behavior change.

What do you think?




---
Refers to: src/swsssdk/interface.py:42 in b8838a8. [](commit_id = b8838a8290a7bc0bdebbc455196f7faed3b7d819, deletion_comment = False)

> > ```
> >             if blocking:
> > ```
> 
> I have second thought about the solution. Since the functions are throwing exceptions with the message, it is the caller's responsibility to handle and log
> 
> 0. We should remove the logging statements from the basic functions `keys`/`get`/`get_all`/etc, if it is followed by a throw.
> 1. We may add the logging statements into the `blocking` branch in the function `wrapped`. Then no behavior change in this condition.
> 2. For non blocking branch, we swallow the `UnavailableDataError` and `return None`. The caller should get well understanding what happening, and even the caller does not handle well, the further exception on None object should be clear. So I think we are okay with the behavior change.
> 
> What do you think?
> 
> Refers to: src/swsssdk/interface.py:42 in [b8838a8](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/commit/b8838a8290a7bc0bdebbc455196f7faed3b7d819). [](commit_id = [b8838a8](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/commit/b8838a8290a7bc0bdebbc455196f7faed3b7d819), deletion_comment = False)

Works for me. I've updated this and the swss-common equivalent: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss-common/pull/566
